meanings.definition: A woman who tempts or entices someone to do something they should not do.
meanings.sent1: The temptresses in the fairy tale lured the hero into danger.
meanings.sent2: The movie portrayed the temptresses as cunning and manipulative characters.
meanings.sent3: The group of temptresses at the party convinced everyone to play a risky game.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like that of a temptress, drawing him into her web of deceit.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the temptresses who try to lead you astray with their sweet words.

meanings.definition: Women who are considered seductive or alluring.
meanings.sent1: The temptresses at the masquerade ball captivated everyone with their beauty.
meanings.sent2: In the old painting, the artist depicted the temptresses with flowing dresses and enchanting gazes.
meanings.sent3: The temptresses at the fashion show made heads turn with their elegant outfits.
meanings.sent4: The city nightlife was filled with temptresses who thrived in the dimly lit clubs.
meanings.sent5: The perfume advertisement featured temptresses who exuded confidence and charm.
